item.title: Ticket #621 (Email notification for UTF-8 Comments garbled) updated
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description:
I came across the same problem too. The mbstring.internal_encoding was set to ISO-... and the conversion mb_send_mail() makes garbled the message subject and body.

Everyhing went fine when I either set the mbstring.internal_encoding to UTF-8 or make WP use the mail() function instead of mb_send_mail().

In fact I do not see a problem WP to always use simply the mail() function, since we know the encoding of the text and there is no need of recoding.

item.title: Ticket #592 (Cannot log in with 1.5) updated
item.dc:creator: solvingnormal
item.description:
There were a few lines that matched the one you mentioned.

setcookie('wordpressuser_'. $cookiehash, $username, time() + 31536000, $cookiepath); setcookie('wordpresspass_'. $cookiehash, $password, time() + 31536000, $cookiepath);

if ( $cookiepath != $sitecookiepath ) {

setcookie('wordpressuser_'. $cookiehash, $username, time() + 31536000, $sitecookiepath); setcookie('wordpresspass_'. $cookiehash, $password, time() + 31536000, $sitecookiepath);

}

I placed the line you gave me right above the first one.

It returned:

Setting cookies with paths / and /wordpress/.

edited on: 02-11-05 13:46

edited on: 02-11-05 13:46

item.title: Ticket #856 ("Pages" has no style) updated
item.dc:creator: lyklev
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #856 ("Pages" has no style) created
item.dc:creator: lyklev
item.description:
In the side bar, just like "Categories", I would like to have an id attached to the "Pages" section, so I can add a style for the "Pages" list item to "style.css" in each style.

This introduces a new style id "li#pages", which should probably be the same as "li#categories" for a consistent look.

item.title: Ticket #592 (Cannot log in with 1.5) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Sounds like wp_setcookie and wp_clearcookie aren't even being called. Let's try adding some debug information. Right before this line in wp_setcookie():

setcookie('wordpressuser_'. $cookiehash, $username, time() + 31536000, $cookiepath);

Add the following two lines:

<pre> echo "Setting cookies with paths $cookiepath and $sitecookiepath.<br />\n"; exit(); </pre> When you try to login you should see the debug message.

edited on: 02-11-05 07:04

item.title: Ticket #752 (Adding Category name to Permalink leads to 404 errors) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
/%category%/%postname%/ is problematic with some mod_rewrite implementations, especially mod_rewrite in Apache 1.3. See the end of the following thread.

â€‹http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=22883

item.title: Ticket #854 (the_author_email no longer encodes email address) updated
item.dc:creator: Kafkaesqui
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #854 (the_author_email no longer encodes email address) created
item.dc:creator: Kafkaesqui
item.description: Previously, the_author_email() was passed through antispambot() to encode an author's email address with the idea it provided some protection from spam email harvesting. It now filters through get_the_author_email, outputting plain text of the address.

item.title: Ticket #592 (Cannot log in with 1.5) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: I tried loggin in with your test user and don't see any cookies being set. Just to verify, your functions.php should have wp_setcookie() and wp_clearcookie() at the end of the file. wp-login.php should be using both of these functions. Do you get any errors in your error log when logging in?

item.title: Ticket #838 (Registration e-mail does not contain password) updated

item.description: Not only does this fix the password-in-the-mail bug, but also turns the form in "wp-register.php" into a regular link, fixing issue #0000839.

item.dc:creator: lowmagnet
item.description: Amended (had to balance losing that spaceL line 494 after fix: $text = preg_replace('|<a (.+?)>|i', '<a $1 rel="nofollow">', $text);

item.title: Ticket #851 (<a* tags all nofollow) updated
item.dc:creator: lowmagnet
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #851 (<a* tags all nofollow) created
item.dc:creator: lowmagnet
item.description: <a/>, <acronym/>, etc. tags all get rel="nofollow" added to the tag. This is due to a bad regexp in functions-formatting.php:wp_rel_nofollow().

Cookie Paths (on both):

I've created a level 1 user for you to see what this bug looks like.. Logon and password are both "test"

item.title: Ticket #592 (Cannot log in with 1.5) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: What are your Blog Address and WordPress address set to in Options->General? What is the path set to in your wordpressuser_* and wordpresspass_* cookies? If no cookies are being set, that is indeed a problem although I'm not sure what would be causing that.

item.title: Ticket #592 (Cannot log in with 1.5) updated
item.dc:creator: solvingnormal
item.description:
This is still persisting for me in the 02/09 nightly.

When I enter the correct username and password, it sends me to /wordpress/wp-login.php?redirect_to=%2Fwordpress%2Fwp-admin%2Findex.php, however this page simply shows the normal wp-login.php page. No cookie is placed onto my computer.

Logging out is similarly futile - it doesn't remove the cookie from my computer. If I remove it manually, I'm stuck out of WordPress until I go back to 1.2.2, login, and then upgrade again.

I have tried all of the advice at â€‹http://codex.wordpress.org/Login_Trouble without avail. The only thing that seems to work is downgrading to 1.2.2, logging in, and then upgrading again.

Is there information I can provide to help track this down?

item.title: Ticket #808 (rss stuff in newest CVS breaks my dashboard XHTML) updated
item.dc:creator: Lionfire
item.description:
I'll confirm gbhugo -- put array_change_key_case.php in wp-includes and add this to the top of rss-functions.php:

if (phpversion() < 4.2) {

require_once('array_change_key_case.php');

}

item.title: Ticket #801 (Warning: array_slice(): The first argument should be an array) updated
item.dc:creator: Lionfire
item.description:
I'm not sure why it isn't working, but changing:

if ( $rss ) {

to:

if ( isset($rss->items) && 0 != count($rss->items) ) {

as with the first call to fetch_rss() stops things breaking further. I'm fairly sure this is a better way to error check here, so the change should be made anyway.

item.title: Ticket #825 (Query based templates not fully armed/operational) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Ok - So I was wrong - sortof.

Going to the "next page" from the main page does not seem to call paged.php. Doing so from a monthly or category archive does call paged.php.

No... only on one of my sites does it do that. paged.php doesn't seem to get called ever on another.

I'm confused.

Until I figure out otherwise, I still think I'm right about year.php etc. :)

item.title: Ticket #849 (Wordpress adds paragraph close, but fails to open paragraph) updated
item.dc:creator: noderat
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #849 (Wordpress adds paragraph close, but fails to open paragraph) created
item.dc:creator: noderat
item.description: When a <div> is added to a post, the latest CVS code will not add a <p> tag to the start of it, however; when a new line is started it will add a </p> which was never opened in the first place. This causes HTML validation errors. This might occur with other elements other than <div>, perhaps <blockquote> as well as others.
